docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The small minority of teen-agers who become heavy users of hard drugs and alcohol in high school are put on a life trajectory that leads to serious problems in young adulthood regardless of whether they continue taking drugs, according to a study released today by the University of California at Los Angeles.

headline.main: 8-Year Study Finds 2 Sides to Teen-Age Drug Use

byline.original: By SANDRA BLAKESLEE, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Food and Drug Administration has decided not to put broad restrictions on the use of sulfites in foods, according to an F.D.A. memorandum obtained today by The Associated Press.

headline.main: F.D.A. Plans No Wide Curbs on Food Sulfites

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Food and Drug Administration has decided not to put broad restrictions on the use of sulfites in foods, according to an F.D.A. memorandum obtained today by The Associated Press.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Consumer confusion about cholesterol prevails as the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute swings into a campaign to get everyone's blood cholesterol tested and, if it is too high, reduce it to a less heart-damaging level. docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Grossly negligent care, including the excessive dispensation of potent drugs, contributed to the death two years ago of a patient at a state-operated psychiatric center in Rockland County, according to a report for release today by the New York State Commission on Quality of Care for the Mentally Disabled.

headline.main: Rockland Psychiatric Center Faulted in a Death
